text: I’ve used a fair share of A/B testing tools in my time and I’ve never been presented with this argument. Surely you want to test your variants against some of you most loyal visitors.
<@U01GW2U4WMA> it can be done within code editor not content editor, the latter was in question here

In the settings Anton suggested, make sure to check your domain specific settings, it could be set as included somewhere

If you add `?hsDebugOnly=true` to your url you will get a summary of all the hubl extends and includes etc (use a pretty json plugin to make it easier to read)

If you’re at a loss you can apply hubl filters to the includes though it’s not recommended
```{{ standard_header_includes|cut('<script src="jquery">') }}```
Only thing with the above is it’s difficult to find out what to actually cut as the code changes slightly when it’s rendered (i’ve had to work my way up cutting a bit at a time to work out if there’s been a double space added or something)

Just saw this new blog post
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog/lesser-known-hubl-tips-and-tricks>
Lots of useful tips
Indeed, lots of great information! Thanks <@UA6LDL887>!
Never thought about updating the widget_data myself!

I guess for the point about `request.query_dict.inpageEditorUI`
You could use the specific variables now so as not to use the request var
```is_in_page_editor```
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#in-app-editor-and-preview-variables>

Hello! any one ever experienced issues deploying UI extensions? they work fine on the machine I built them on but other users cant see the content of custom cards the developer console reveals the browser is trying to reach out to a local/extensions server (Which of course will not be on their machines)

Developing a public app for an event management platform on HubSpot market place for contact sync.
Each event will have unique URL and Access Key(API KEY). On Install how would I handle that?
Hi all can we use PHP in HubSpot if yes then how? I have not used it before. can anyone help me with that

If you know PHP and even maybe ACF with WordPress you’ll feel right at home with the HubL syntax

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl>

Hey y'all

Anybody finding significant issues with the Salesforce native integration recently?

Issues I'm finding (in a few different portals):
• Name fields not syncing
• Fields not found in the data mapping feature (regular fields - no lookup or calculation- accessible by the integration user)
• Associations messing not syncing

I have a question concerning my <https://19807175.HubSpotpreview-na1.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?businessUnitId=0&domain=default&hsPreviewerApp=template&hs_preview_key=undefined&portalId=19807175&tc_deviceCategory=desktop&template_file_path=%40HubSpot%2Fcms-quotes-theme%2Ftemplates%2Foriginal.html&updated=1723056132392&|quote template>. This quote template has a background image in it. I went to the html file code to try to locate the image to remove it but was unable to find it. I'm happy to share the code if necessary. The code itself is not directly editable, and I know I can duplicate it as a child. I will say, I don't know how to change what html file is used across quote templates. Please let me know if there is any help or suggestions you can offer, thanks!
this colorful geometric shaped background is what I am trying to remove.
I would look at the css for any url() declarations for backgrounds on elements
Or can you share a published quote url?

Hi <@U047SNMFE4U>, PHP is not possible in HubSpot.
HubSpot has it's own templating language called Hubl, like <@U03MU3H35R6> mentioned. Hubl is based on Jinja/Django and a mix of HTML. CSS and JS. You can work with plain HTML or utilize a JS framework like react, vue or similiar.
Also: Even if there's something not documented in the HubSpot dev docs, it _might_ work if it's written/documented in Jinja.
